intro: Camelina foetida var. integerrima, commonly known as the stinking cameline, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes other mustard family plants. The species is noted for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is particularly noticeable in its flowers.
